item.title: What is a Monoid, Exactly?
item.description:
Let’s talk about some math concepts in this context. Remember those lessons about identity, commutativity, associativity, and distributivity? Yeah, me neither. But these laws are quite important in the context of monoids. A monoid comes from mathematics. In abstract algebra, a monoid is a set equipped with an associative binary operation and an identity element.

Semigroup

In mathematics, a semigroup is a structure with a binary operation that satisfies the law of associativity.
